availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Standhope A. Lively (Henderson County and Webster County, Kentucky, farmer, pvt 35th Ky Mtd Inf.)

body.p: Henderson County and Webster County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. North Carolina native. Son of John C. Lively and Phoebe Lively. Married to Martha Jane Shelton Lively in Henderson County, Kentucky, on March 18, 1852. Father of Ransom N. Lively, Josiah C. Lively, Amy M. Lively, and Margie L. Lively. Resident of Henderson County in 1850. Farmer in Webster County in 1860. Served in the 35th Kentucky Volunteer Mounted Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from October 2, 1863, to December 29, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, District 2, p. 311A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, p. 506.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Henderson County Marriages, Film #000576460, p. 126.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 356.
"Standhope A. Lively (1830-1890)," Find A Grave, Memorial #106011206, accessed January 11, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/106011206.
